post.author: LDAsh
post.body:
That's a good start, I think. Great for beginners who just want to get their stuff in-game ASAP.
For more advanced material creators, it would be great to have some portable stand-alone application with visual references, perhaps not needing to render normalmaps and real-time lighting, but stuff like tables and scrolling/rotations/deforms, to be able to actually see these things as they are edited. Something like good old Q3ASE would be excellent, something we can work on materials with, without needing to install the whole fat engine.

post.author: New Horizon
post.body:
I was hoping someone would do something like this. I would have loved to see it incorporated into our customized version of Dark Radiant as a plugin of sorts, but it refuses to run without .NET...grrr...and Dark Radiant is cross platform.

Thanks for the work, but if it's limited to windows only I won't be using it.
